content: old shale waves by carroll davis-johnson a traditional pattern for the modern baby instructions this blanket is designed with an easy 4 row repeat the placement of color is up to you each repeat uses between 15-17 yards of yarn materials depending on your gauge determine how many repeats each ball of yarn will allow and then start coloring we have included a needles us10 32 circular needles drawing on the next page for you to map out your colors each yarn 600+ yards of chunky weight yarn dotted line represents the end of the 4 row repeat notions 7 stitch markers 1 tapestry needle cast on 114 size garter stitch edge and set up row row 1-3 sl1wyif knit to end of row approx 29 x29 row 4 sl1wyif knit 2 pm knit 18 pm repeat 6 times knit 3 this row places markers to indicate three stitch edges and the 18- gauge stitch pattern repeats 18 stitches = 4 in old shale pattern old shale pattern abbreviations row 1 sl1wyif knit to end of row row 2 sl1wyif knit 2 purl to last marker knit 3 pm=place stitch marker row 3 sl1wyif knit 2 *k2tog three times yo knit 1 six times k2tog=knit 2 stitches together k2tog three times repeat from * six times knit 3 sl1wyif=slip 1 with yarn in front row 4 sl1wyif knit to end of row yo=yarn over repeat row 1 -4 of the old shale pattern until desired length notes end with 4 row as follows sl1wyif knit to end of row want a bigger blanket cast
